intro: Machaerium eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its botanical features include pinnate leaves with serrated edges and yellowish or white flowers that attract pollinators. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along riverbanks.
